intro: Uragoga triantha, commonly known as the three-lobed uragoga, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves, which are divided into three lobes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Uragoga triantha thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
